questionTitle: Which of the following is the deployment model?
questionExplanation: Public, private, community, and hybrid clouds are deployment models.

questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: All applications benefit from deployment in the cloud
questionOption2: With cloud computing, you can start very small and become big very fast
questionOption3: Cloud computing is revolutionary, even if the technology it is built on is evolutionary
questionExplanation: Issues with latency, transaction control, and in particular security and regulatory compliance are of particular concern.

questionTitle: Which of the following is often a bottleneck in Web servers?
questionExplanation: Network I/O (D) reaches its maximum 100-percent utilization at about 50 percent of the tested load, and this factor is the current system resource ceiling.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a SaaS characteristic?
questionOption1: The typical license is subscription-based or usage-based and is billed on a recurring basis
questionOption2: The software is available over the Internet globally through a browser on demand
questionOption3: The software and the service are monitored and maintained by the vendor
questionExplanation: There may be executable client-side code, but the user isn’t responsible for maintaining that code or its interaction with the service.

questionTitle: Microsoft’s Office Web Apps are written in _______ and eventually are to be supplemented with Silverlight features.
questionExplanation: Microsoft’s Office Web Apps are online slimmed-down versions of the Microsoft Office suite.

questionTitle: Network bottlenecks occur when ______ data sets must be transferred.
questionExplanation: This is the case for staging,

questionTitle: APIs and Deployment are second level application attributes in accordance with ____________
questionExplanation: Deconstructing an application’s critical functionality is only half the process.

questionTitle: Which was the first free hosted Webmail service to the user?
questionExplanation: Microsoft acquired HotMail a year later and rebranded it as MSN Hotmail.

questionTitle: Which of the following version of WSDL is a W3C standard?
questionExplanation: The Web Service Description Language (WSDL) is one of the most commonly used XML protocols for messaging in Web services.

questionTitle: Which of the following standard is meant to span the different vendors’ standards and cloud infrastructure?
questionExplanation: SNIA and the Open Grid Forum have created a joint working group to create the Open Cloud Computing Interface (OCCI).

questionTitle: _________ applications have a much lower barrier to entry than their locally installed competitors.
questionExplanation: Such applications feature automated upgrades, updates, and patch management and much faster rollout of changes.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a structured data store that supports indexing and data queries to both EC2 and S3?
questionExplanation: SimpleDB isn’t a full database implementation.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the audio streaming application by Microsoft?
questionExplanation: Skype is a telecommunications application software product that specializes in providing video chat and voice calls from the computer.

questionTitle: Which of the following standard is used for publishing a Web service that is used in cloud computing?
questionExplanation: WSDL standard contributes to the Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).

questionTitle: Which of the following is the most widely used technique for abstraction?
questionExplanation: With load balancing, system requests are directed to appropriate systems on demand.

questionTitle: Which of the following technologies are used in LongJump’s PaaS?
questionExplanation: Its development environment is based on Java and uses REST/SOAP APIs.

questionTitle: Which of the following is used for synchronization and remote access service for files stored on PCs and mobile devices?
questionExplanation: Windows Live Family Safety allows you to manage and monitor your children’s Internet activity so they can surf the Web more safely.

questionTitle: Which of the following layer of Wolf platform architecture is depicted in the following figure?
questionExplanation: In Wolf, the data and transaction management conforms to the business rules you create.

questionTitle: ________ is the iconic flash video-sharing service now owned by Google.
questionExplanation: To use YouTube inside a browser, you need to have Adobe Flash installed on your computer.

questionTitle: Which of the following is essential concept related to Cloud?
questionExplanation: Cloud computing abstracts the details of system implementation from users and developers.

questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: In Gmail, you cannot construct searches with multiple operators using the Advanced Search feature
questionOption2: Google uses an advertiser-driven model to supply its free service to users
questionOption3: RSS content can be read in most modern browsers
questionExplanation: In its search function, Google uses the keywords from your search and your search history to match sponsors to you.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the operational domain of CSA?
questionExplanation: CSA is an industry working group that studies security issues in cloud computing and offers recommendations to its members.

questionTitle: Which of the following monitors the performance of the major cloud-based services in real time in Cloud Commons?
questionExplanation: The Cloud Commons is a new online community founded by CA to promote information exchange on cloud services and the SMI standard.

questionTitle: Which of the following is an online atlas and mapping service with mashups?
questionExplanation: Google Earth lets you fly anywhere on Earth to view satellite imagery, maps, terrain, 3D buildings, from galaxies in outer space to the canyons of the ocean.

questionTitle: _______ blurs the differences between a small deployment and a large one because scale becomes tied only to demand.
questionExplanation: The virtualization of pooled resources—processors or compute engines, storage, and network connectivity—optimizes these investments and allows the cloud provider to pass along these economies to customers.

questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: OpenID 2.0 is the standard associated with creating an identity
questionOption2: OpenID doesn’t specify the means for authentication of identity
questionOption3: OpenID provides access to important Web sites
questionExplanation: Authentication can be by a Challenge and Response Protocol (CHAP).

questionTitle: _________ computing refers to applications and services that run on a distributed network using virtualized resources.
questionExplanation: Cloud Computing applications are accessed by common Internet protocols and networking standards.

questionTitle: How many security accounts per client is provided by Microsoft?
questionExplanation: On Amazon Web Service, you can create multiple keys and rotate those keys during different sessions.

questionTitle: Which of the following element in SOMF determines how components are exposed?
questionExplanation: In SOMF, the modeling is based on the elements of the service life cycle.

questionTitle: How many types of service model are mainly present in Cloud?
questionExplanation: Three types of Service model exist.
